tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The parliamentary sitting week continues with coverage of Question Time from the Senate.

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.sub-title: 1981: Billy Connolly, Delilah, Kenny Everett, Richard Walsh
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson interviews guests Billy Connolly, Delilah, Kenny Everett and Richard Walsh.

In an Australian exclusive, former US Vice-President Kamala Harris tells Sarah Ferguson she is contemplating a second run for the presidency and says she was "reckless" to not act to stop Joe Biden running for a second term.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: End Game with Tony Armstrong
programme.desc: Tony investigates how athlete activism can combat racism in sport, questioning why Australia often resists outspoken athletes like Adam Goodes.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The sitting week concludes with coverage of Question Time from the Senate. Parliament returns on Monday 3 November.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Mother of three, Samantha Whyte is searching for the Swiss father she has never met. We also meet Vanda James, who is looking to put an end to a secret that has haunted her family for over fifty years.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two family mysteries; a man left in a pram as a baby, is searching for his birth mother to discover the truth about his beginnings, and a daughter looking for the Italian birth father she has never met.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Zimbabwean born Davi and Matt from Australia set out to build a radical multicultural house, but from the start the project is a gruelling, plate-spinning exercise.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The parliamentary sitting week concludes with coverage of Question Time from the House of Representatives. Parliament resumes on Monday 3 November.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Tino Carnevale meets friends who met via a garden program, Costa Georgiadis builds a frog bog at a preschool, Sophie Thomson meets volunteers who have replanted a woodland and Jerry Coleby-Williams looks at volunteer plants.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Following Events Are Based On Lies
programme.sub-title: Act Three: Further Down the Rabbit Hole
programme.desc: Alice continues to build her case against Rob and meets another of his exes. She decides that, together, theyll be able to convince Cheryl just who Rob really is.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: At Rye on the Mornington Peninsula, Ryan plans to build a unique home, with boulders in the living room, and his bedroom in a cave.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: We search on behalf of 50-year-old Deborah Ozturk, who has spent years longing to find her birth mother and thank her for the incredible sacrifice she made in giving her up as a baby.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Backyard Habitat and Pruning Natives
programme.desc: Jane discovers a lush urban courtyard, Josh joins a research team tracking backyard biodiversity, Hannah explores a flourishing cottage garden, Millie tackles native maintenance, and we meet award-winning poultry breeders.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Chasing after Tom Gleesons Big Brass Mug this week on Hard Quiz are experts in Suzi Quatro, multi-level marketing, The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, and dirt. Yes, dirt!

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Leigh Sales hosts The Assembly, where she mentors Autistic journalist students as they interview legendary Aussie cook and businesswoman, Maggie Beer. (Final)

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Tunic and Trials With Kaden From Maverix
programme.desc: We review the charming and mysterious adventures of Tunic, plus we see if Sebastian Tangs time riding motocross bikes as Kaden on the new show MaveriX will help him get through some Trials tracks!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Find out why Dr Chris is giving Dr Xand a vaccination in the lab, its time to meet our Ouch babies as theyre born, and get some mindfulness tips in todays Mindboosters.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: When pests swarm a party, Jedi jump in to help.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When a chicken ends up inside Shauns pillowcase, Shaun tries to get it back, only for the chicken to end up in the farmhouse - and the Farmer to think he is being haunted by a chicken ghost.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo
programme.desc: The Columbus Zoo and Aquarium makes room for three adorable new cheetah cubs.

programme.title: The Mysterious Benedict Society
programme.sub-title: A Gold Bar in Fort Knox
programme.desc: The children make some dangerous wagers while Benedict takes a gamble with Curtain.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: With the kitchen lab upside down, the doctors reveal the incredible job of your optic nerve and show you how to make your own eye-popping game.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xands been messing around with Dr Chris greenhouse and prize winning strawberries to show how your trachea works. The doctors get quizzed in Ouchology and meet three incredible Ouch Awards nominees.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nubs tracks down a harvest taken by birds.

programme.title: The Ghastly Ghoul
programme.sub-title: The Horrible Haunted Hospital Of Dr. Phineas Phrag!
programme.desc: A little monster from Halloween World is stranded in the human world on Halloween Night after trick or treating too much, and its up to one girl to face her fears and help the monster return home.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The heat winners in shows 1 to 5 come back to fight again. The judges must choose one Wild Card from the runners-up to join them. Every team left standing battles it out to make it to the grand final of Robot Wars.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve heads into the heart of the Suriname Jungle. He goes in search of poison dart frogs, deadly snakes and hopes to find the elusive giant river otter

programme.title: Documentary Now!
programme.desc: Monologist Parker Gail and director Harrison Renzi team up to present Gails engaging and confessional theatre piece, Location is Everything.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors reveal how you taste with your nose as well as your tongue, Dr Xand is on call with the emergency services, and Dr Chris discovers how 3D printing works when he prints his own skull.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: Legend Of The Moonstone
programme.desc: Freddy Lupin manages to convince the pack elders to let him sit Howlington Academys entrance test. Freddy must use all his poodle wits (and his best friend Battys help) to win a place at the historically wolf-only academy.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: In order to live under the sea the Bears must transform into mermaids.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Cyborg and Beast Boy annoy the other Titans.

programme.title: Pokemon: Diamond And Pearl
programme.desc: As our heroes make their way to Twinleaf Town via ferry, a group of injured Pokemon challenges Brock to develop new skills, giving him new ideas for the future!

programme.title: Further Back In Time For Dinner: The Development Of A Nation
programme.desc: Our family travel back to the 1910s when the first census of the Commonwealth was released, World War One broke out and the end of the war introduced the observation of Remembrance Day.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: Speaking in sign language Native American style and making a dream catcher from wire, beads and feathers. Plus toys made from corn and making a coup stick or story stick from feathers and wood.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: John, a tailor from London, dreams of creating his own office space in the garden so he can spend more time closer to home after the arrival of a newborn baby.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George Clarke takes on a 600 year old piece of Welsh folklore that claims if you can build a house with four walls, a roof and have a fire burning within a day, then that house and land is yours. (Final)

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Private donors are paying for the White House ballroom and even the US military. Who are they and what do they get in return? And is it legal? Plus the shutdown threatens food stamps and the "hostile act" of a Canadian TV ad.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: The Harpers family Christmas looks to be even more fearsome than usual for Ben as Susan gives Kenzo a third birthday party to remember, Michael becomes a postie, and Nicks musician friend Alfie Butts turns up. (Final)

programme.title: The Stand Up Sketch Show
programme.desc: Breakneck comedy show packed with stand-up routines from top comics, brought to life in sketch form. Featuring Rhys James, Helen Bauer, Gbemi Oladipo, Paddy Young and Esther Manito.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors fill their bladders - quite literally - to show what happens when you go for a wee. Dr Chris meets a robot that can zap bad cells, and Dr Xand is in the Ouch-Mobile ready for more medical mysteries.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: Legend Of The Moonstone
programme.desc: Its the first day of school, and Freddy immediately comes into conflict with bully Ivan, who blackmails him into stealing the sacred moonstone! But when Batty is exposed to the moonstone, shes turned into a human girl!

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Charlie hosts an evening of spooky stories.

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Defending the house on Halloween, Charlies in for a fright when Pierce invites the neighbourhood (and at least one monster) over for a costume party. They must trick the gatecrasher to reveal itself before it gets its treat!

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Raven tries to put the spirit of Halloween back in Halloween.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The Titans want to be the scariest trick-or-treaters in town, so Raven casts a spell that turns them into real monsters.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent Specials
programme.desc: Phils going undercover in the East Midlands where, latest figures show, it takes longer to sell your house than anywhere else in England. (Final)

programme.title: Ride Like A Girl
programme.desc: The story of Michelle Payne, the first female jockey to win the Melbourne Cup. After early failures, a family tragedy and a near-fatal horse fall, Michelle beat the odds to ride Prince of Penzance into the history books.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: In the Toy House, everybody is reading books when the little toy tub appears, Moon Baby catches it. In Storyland, the big tub appears and Moon Baby decides he will catch that too.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Mort cant wait to look after Beeps spaceship. But hes so busy daydreaming he forgets to listen to Beeps instructions. Left to his own devices, he presses the wrong button which sends him hurtling into space! Or does it?

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Jango loses his new pet caterpillar and follows the trail of eaten leaves, vegetables and fruit. He must find him before the others realise his pet has caused all the damage, but Detective Ziggy is close behind.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: At the Wildlife Park all is quiet - maybe the Sound Collector can change that.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Its a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bings paddling pool and they go to the rescue.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family go for a walk in the woods. Peppa and George discover trails left by birds and ants. When they get lost they follow their own footprints back to the picnic.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer is off on holiday, confident hes left the farm in safe hands. However, the animals quickly learn his replacement is only interested in looking after himself! Dismayed and hungry, they decide he has to go.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy leads a whirlwind tour of the Seven Wonders of Pontypandy, but her haste to make it to all seven leads to a fire at her campsite!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The visitors land on the Moon and begin to explore. They meet some friendly aliens and have fun making Sandcastles and sharing their picnic. Nanny creates a Jelly flood but luckily the Aliens love to eat Jelly!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends visit the Little Cars play centre where Miss Rabbit is in charge.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: On a paddle board expedition, the cadets get stranded on a desert island. Meanwhile, Neville goes on a journey to become the ultimate balance master.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Frankie and Zoes forest adventure teaches safety, teamwork, and courage with help from Forest Ranger Ben.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Rakhi
programme.desc: Nikhil and Jay want to make each other a rakhi, a protection bracelet. But first they need to decide who is the best protector!

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector discovers starlings, and an amazing display of sound and movement.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: What makes stars twinkle? Miah learns all about stars and constellations from Karlie Noon the astronomer and together, they make their own twinkling stars!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Captain Feathersword and Paloma the Mermaid are in the Wiggly Kitchen waiting for The Wiggles to arrive. Captain has found a letter inviting him to come for a dance, who could the letter be from?

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: T is having his best day ever - until S joins in and it all goes very wrong. This episode has fun with the ST blend and the words top, tub, tag, stop, stub, stag, lost and best.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is night time at Grandpa and Granny Pigs house, Peppa and George have stayed up late to help hunt for slugs and snails. But what other night animals will they find?

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Millie and her friends build a scarecrow when some pesky crows keep pecking at their pumpkins.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: While working on a comic book of his childhood Cree stories, Mikisew tells the Dream Factory Crew about his tree fort and inspires them to hunt for the lost hang out.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Jelly Fish Bloom
programme.desc: When Shellington gets trapped in the middle of a massive Jellyfish bloom, its up to the Octonauts to rescue him!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Tag gets lost in the Lost Property room in the clubhouse and the squirrels must find him!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Diesel plays a trick on Rebecca to try and get the other engines in trouble for a change.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Clarence and the kids explore the area of La Perouse, next to Botany Bay, looking for the endangered Eastern Suburbs Banksia Scrub. Our team will extract the seeds from Banksia cones with fire and plant the seeds.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Its a Halloween Party! Join The Wiggles as they prepare for the big party by singing, dancing, and making toffee apples!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Dracs messy magic show teaches him that mastering any skill takes practice and persistence, as he transforms his failures into a spectacular success.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family have landed in Italy, where they discover another spoken language. Daddy Pig finds driving around a little hard. Peppa rings Granny and Grandpa Pig to check are looking after Goldie the Fish.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Newton becomes bad when hes changed by a mysterious asteroid.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddingtons excited about the grand opening of the city farm, but the animals escape when the gate is left open - will they find them in time?

programme.title: Rocket Club
programme.desc: Rocket Club is floating on cloud nine when they get invited to the Gravitron Variable Gravity Training Center, but a jealous Calvin brings them down to earth.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Inside the Little Toy House, Colly Wobble discovers a toy suitcase. In Storyland, Colly Wobble decides to take her suitcase on a journey far away.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Olive wants to try ice skating, but Clem says its not safe while holding her blankie. But blankie goes with her everywhere! So Mort tells Olive the story of the mollybird who didnt want to hatch from her egg.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Mimi is so tired she needs a holiday but cant decide where to go. So her friends take her on three pretend holidays to help her choose.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector listens to the wonderful sound of a piano from inside and out.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula enjoy painting a giant mural at Ammas nursery until Bings enthusiastic rainbow painting makes paint run all over Sulas beautiful tree.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa has a new pen pal in France, named Delphine. Peppa speaks to her on the telephone. Although Peppa speaks English and Delphine French, they discover that they love lots of the same things, especially muddy puddles.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its almost time for the ice cream van to pay its daily visit and Bitzer has his heart set on a well-earned treat. However, his work is not done - theres a whole list of chores standing in his way.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato runs in fright when Pumpkin tries to make friends with him, but he later realises she needs his help as shes stuck in the air hanging from balloons set up by Evil Pea.

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Is there really a ghost at Jacksons pumpkin patch? Mojo and Bo need to find out!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The children decorate the clubhouse to make it scary for Halloween but not too scary. The kids give the grownups a tour and thy pretend to be scared but the kids reassure them its not too scary.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes have their plans thwarted when a large Pumpkinsaurus blocks their way into the Spooky Forest.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters Halloween fun turns chaotic, but by taking responsibility and working together, they fix their mistakes and make Halloween unforgettable.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley must keep Myrtles pumpkin safe from Speedy the snail.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Mole prefers treats to tricks at Halloween. The Sound Collector follows on her trail.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Can we create our own geodes? Dr Tara Djokic teaches Matt all about magnificent geodes and together they create their own geodes using empty eggshells.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The spooky hijinx continues as Orticia gets carried away by tricking, not treating - resulting in (mild) Halloween horror.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds meet the cutest kittens and discover the super powers of our furry friends! Cats come in many colors and sizes, and all kinds of beautiful fur. But check this out - some dont have any fur at all!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family have landed in Italy, where they discover another spoken language. Daddy Pig finds driving around a little hard. Peppa rings Granny and Grandpa Pig to check are looking after Goldie the Fish.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: After helping everyone else with their jack-o-lanterns, Millie finally settles on building a Millie-O-Lantern for Pumpkinfest in the Park.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: While working on a comic book of his childhood Cree stories, Mikisew tells the Dream Factory Crew about his tree fort and inspires them to hunt for the lost hang out.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Scary Spookfish
programme.desc: The Octonauts try to pull Peso out of an oceanic trench and get some help from a strange-looking creature with a see-through head - a Spookfish.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are working together to find Enid when they notice that she is at the top of the Mighty Sugar Bun Mountain.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Thomas causes confusion and delay by not seeking help when he makes a mistake.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah takes the kids to Kimbriki Tip to find some items suitable for making a garden out of refuse. They make a flower bed from an old pram, some oars and a wheelbarrow.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Get ready for some Halloween fun! Sing, dress Up and enjoy your favourite Halloween songs, plus some craft-time fun!

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Rosa asks Tish what she wants to be for Halloween, but Tish still isnt sure, and is having a hard time deciding.

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: Ursulas spooky mirror traps everyone.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is the first day in their holiday villa, Peppa and her family go exploring to the local village where there is pizza to eat, presents to buy and a post card to be sent to Goldie the Fish.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: When Newton turns his back on his space powers, Luna exploits him to get back to the moon.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Its Halloween and Paddington goes Treat or Treating with Jonathan and Judy around Windsor Gardens, but Mr Curry does not want to join in... or does he? And why is Mrs Bird not scared at all?

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The parliamentary sitting week continues with coverage of Question Time from the Senate.

programme.desc: Alice continues to build her case against Rob and meets another of his exes. She decides that, together, theyll be able to convince Cheryl just who Rob really is.

programme.desc: Jane discovers a lush urban courtyard, Josh joins a research team tracking backyard biodiversity, Hannah explores a flourishing cottage garden, Millie tackles native maintenance, and we meet award-winning poultry breeders.

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Leigh Sales hosts The Assembly, where she mentors Autistic journalist students as they interview legendary Aussie cook and businesswoman, Maggie Beer. (Final)

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Michael Tetlow brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: Tony Albert is one of the most exciting visual artists of his generation. He takes everyday items that represent the most confronting aspects of colonisation to create work that is provocative and deeply moving.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Yvonne Yong presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As each day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday present the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, joined by Emma Rebellato, Catherine Murphy and Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.sub-title: Murray Watt - Minister for the Environment
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Ros Childs brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days top stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Manny Tsigas.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Yvonne Yong presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Boyer Lecture Series
programme.desc: John Anderson, AC, farmer, grazier and former deputy prime minister, whose talk, Our Civilisational Moment argues that Australia lacks the spirit, not the machinery of democracy.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Not Stupid
programme.sub-title: Who wins between Trump and Chinas Xi
programme.desc: Jez and guest host Emma Shortis preview the Trump-Xi meeting and what it means for the future of relations between the US and China. Plus what can the New York mayoral race tell us about the future of the US Democratic Party?

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: A world-first mRNA vaccine for Foot-and-mouth disease; and a new all-natural fabric that combines wool with cotton.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, investors, employees and businesses big and small. Presented by Alicia Barry.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: A world-first mRNA vaccine for Foot-and-mouth disease; and a new all-natural fabric that combines wool with cotton.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Lorna Dunkley brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: Your daily download of everything you need to know about politics, national and global affairs. Patricia Karvelas asks politicians the tough questions and talks to key players and experts on the issues driving the news cycle.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: When you need to know whats going on across the country and around the globe, turn to Joe OBrien for a comprehensive roundup of the days news plus original reporting on the issues that affect you.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Manny Tsigas brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: Inflation came in much hotter than economists were expecting, with consumer prices rising at an annual pace of 3.2%, up from 2.1% in the June quarter, dampening hopes of an interest rate cut on Melbourne Cup Day next week.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong brings you a weekly roundup of the stories making news across the Asia region, plus whats trending on social media and making an impact on the culture and the way people live.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget Brennan, James Glenday, Emma Rebellato, Catherine Murphy, Charles Brice and Nate Byrne hear from some of the guests who appeared on News Breakfast. Plus film critic Zak Hepburn and resident foodie Alice Zaslavsky.
